title: Blocking Property With Respect To Specified Harmful Foreign Activities of the Government of the Russian Federation

enrichment.summary: This executive order blocks property and restricts financial dealings of individuals and entities connected to harmful actions by the Russian government, including interference in elections, cyber attacks, corruption, and threats to security. It also restricts entry into the U.S. for certain individuals tied to these activities and authorizes government agencies to enforce these sanctions to address a national security threat.
potential_concerns: Sanctions may unintentionally impact innocent individuals or businesses with indirect ties to designated persons, causing economic disruption.

Enforcement complexities could arise in accurately identifying and tracking entities and individuals, especially with efforts to evade sanctions using digital currencies or complex ownership structures.
Restrictions on entry may raise concerns about due process or diplomatic retaliation from allied governments.
Overly broad definitions of prohibited activities risk capturing legitimate technological or commercial activities, potentially harming U.S.-Russia economic engagement where not intended.
The order could increase geopolitical tensions and provoke retaliatory measures from the Russian Federation, complicating diplomatic relations.
